segments.text: So today we got Kyle and we're here with the new and improved version of this massive thing
Kyle you want to give us a walk around about this tell us a little bit about it
So right now you got the TXL $2,000 right here
It's a $1,000 so it's a $2,000 rated operating capacity
So that's an ISO standard we have to publish but the tipping load on it's 5,700 pounds
So 35% of that again the standard that you publish makes it 2,000 pound rated operating capacity machine
The thing that's different about this than anything else in the market right now for a stand-on compact utility loader
is the telescoping unit
So it has the ability to reach over a flatbed truck and lift up a pallet of sod or pallet of bricks
and bring it back across and unload it from one side of the truck
So you can load and unload from one side of a flatbed instead of going around the both sides
A lot narrower than your typical track loader so it's 54 inches wide
Typical track loader probably is around 66 to 72 inches wide
It's a lighter machine and 6,700 pounds so a lot bigger than the TXL $1,000
But a lot smaller than your typical track loader with the same 50 capabilities
It's got a 50 horsepower Kubota D1803 turbo
No regen it's got a DOC which is the diesel oxidation catalyst
There's no downtime on this machine itself to regen
Other than that, it's a much larger machine for a stand-on
You can do the same capabilities as a sitting machine
But the accessibility and visibility are much improved and a lot of the contractors like that
So that's why we came out with it
We've done our homework and that's why we came to the market with this machine
Alright guys of course you've seen it with the mulch
They've got different attachments you can attach to this as well
That's very loud out here so I hope you can hear me
But we're going to show you a, this is just a power extend
But this has the claw on top of the bucket
Pretty much to pick up your logs and stuff to drop them in whatever
I'm going to show you that as well so let's show you this
